Politics.title: Budget 2025: Key points at a glance

Politics.title: Properties worth more than £2m in England face new tax
Politics.description: The surcharge begins at £2,500, rising to £7,500 for properties valued at more than £5m.

Politics.title: Two-child benefit cap to be scrapped from next year
Politics.description: The policy, introduced under the Tories, means parents can only claim universal credit for their first two children.

Politics.title: Electric vehicle owners to face pay-per-mile tax
Politics.description: Drivers of electric cars will pay a road charge of 3p per mile, while plug-in hybrid drivers will pay 1.5p per mile from April 2028.

Politics.title: Reeves unveils tax rises and ends two-child benefit cap
Politics.description: The Chancellor has extended a freeze on income tax and National Insurance thresholds, meaning millions will be dragged into paying higher rates as their wages increase.

Politics.description: Downgrades to productivity means the economy is set to grow at an annual rate of 1.5% on average over the next five years.
